<u>Genus Orbitolites</u>.

I _ <u>History</u> 

1. The Orbitolite has been chiefly known, until
very recently, rather by its fossil, than by its existing
forms. The abundant occurrence of <s>the</s> its disks in the
<u>Calcaire grossier</u> of the Paris basin, early attracted attention;
but Orbitolites were not clearly distinguished by the older
observers from Nummulites, and their true nature was
entirely misunderstood. Thus we find them designated, often
in association with Nummulites, under the title of
<u>Umbilicus marinus</u> by Plaucus ([Biauchi?]), who imagined
